all_settings.title: Stats Logger
all_settings.description: Realtime stats logger, a StatsD implementation exists

all_settings.title: Event Logger
all_settings.description: By default will log events to the metadata database with `DBEventLogger` Note that you can use `StdOutEventLogger` for debugging Note that you can write your own event logger by extending `AbstractEventLogger` https://github.com/apache/superset/blob/master/superset/utils/log.py

all_settings.title: Superset Security View Menu
all_settings.description: This config is used to enable/disable the folowing security menu items: List Users, List Roles, List Groups

all_settings.title: Favicons
all_settings.description: "href":path/to/image.png", "sizes": "16x16", "type": "image/png" "rel": "icon" },

all_settings.title: Alembic Skip Log Config
all_settings.description: If True, we will skip the call to load the logger config found in alembic.init

all_settings.title: Version String
all_settings.description: version_info.json file may or may not be available, as it is generated on install via setup.py. In the event that we're actually running Superset, we will have already installed, therefore it WILL exist. When unit tests are running, however, it WILL NOT exist, so we fall back on reading package.json

all_settings.title: Build Number
all_settings.description: Build number is shown in the About section if available. This can be replaced at build time to expose build information.

all_settings.title: Default Viz Type
all_settings.description: default viz used in chart explorer & SQL Lab explore

all_settings.title: Row Limit
all_settings.description: default row limit when requesting chart data

all_settings.title: Samples Row Limit
all_settings.description: default row limit when requesting samples from datasource in explore view

all_settings.title: Native Filter Default Row Limit
all_settings.description: default row limit for native filters

all_settings.title: Filter Select Row Limit
all_settings.description: max rows retrieved by filter select auto complete

all_settings.title: Default Time Filter
all_settings.description: default time filter in explore values may be "Last day", "Last week", "<ISO date> : now", etc.

all_settings.title: Superset Webserver Timeout
all_settings.description: This is an important setting, and should be lower than your [load balancer / proxy / envoy / kong / ...] timeout settings. You should also make sure to configure your WSGI server (gunicorn, nginx, apache, ...) timeout setting to be <= to this setting

all_settings.title: Superset Dashboard Periodical Refresh Limit
all_settings.description: this 2 settings are used by dashboard period force refresh feature When user choose auto force refresh frequency < SUPERSET_DASHBOARD_PERIODICAL_REFRESH_LIMIT they will see warning message in the Refresh Interval Modal. please check PR #9886

all_settings.title: Superset Dashboard Periodical Refresh Warning Message
Secret Key
all_settings.description: Your App secret key. Make sure you override it on superset_config.py or use `SUPERSET_SECRET_KEY` environment variable. Use a strong complex alphanumeric string and use a tool to help you generate a sufficiently random sequence, ex: openssl rand -base64 42"

all_settings.title: Sqlalchemy Database Uri
all_settings.description: The SQLAlchemy connection string.

all_settings.title: Sqlalchemy Engine Options
all_settings.description: that may be specific to the database engine you are using. Note that you can use this to set the isolation level of your database, as in `SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS = {"isolation_level": "READ COMMITTED"}` Also note that we recommend READ COMMITTED for regular operation. Find out more here https://flask-sqlalchemy.palletsprojects.com/en/3.1.x/config/

all_settings.title: Sqlalchemy Custom Password Store
all_settings.description: example: def lookup_password(url): return 'secret' SQLALCHEMY_CUSTOM_PASSWORD_STORE = lookup_password

all_settings.title: Sqlalchemy Encrypted Field Type Adapter
all_settings.description: ) raise Exception("Missing app_config kwarg") SQLALCHEMY_ENCRYPTED_FIELD_TYPE_ADAPTER = AesGcmEncryptedAdapter

all_settings.title: Query Search Limit
all_settings.description: The limit of queries fetched for query search

all_settings.title: Wtf Csrf Enabled
all_settings.description: Flask-WTF flag for CSRF

all_settings.title: Wtf Csrf Exempt List
all_settings.description: Add endpoints that need to be exempt from CSRF protection

all_settings.title: Debug
all_settings.description: Whether to run the web server in debug mode or not

all_settings.title: Profiling
all_settings.description: Enable profiling of Python calls. Turn this on and append ``?_instrument=1`` to the page to see the call stack.

all_settings.title: Show Stacktrace
all_settings.description: Superset allows server-side python stacktraces to be surfaced to the user when this feature is on. This may have security implications and it's more secure to turn it off in production settings.

all_settings.title: Enable Proxy Fix
all_settings.description: Use all X-Forwarded headers when ENABLE_PROXY_FIX is True. When proxying to a different port, set "x_port" to 0 to avoid downstream issues.

all_settings.title: Ratelimit Enabled
all_settings.description: FAB Rate limiting: this is a security feature for preventing DDOS attacks. The feature is on by default to make Superset secure by default, but you should fine tune the limits to your needs. You can read more about the different parameters here: https://flask-limiter.readthedocs.io/en/stable/configuration.html

all_settings.title: App Name
all_settings.description: ------------------------------ GLOBALS FOR APP Builder ------------------------------ Uncomment to setup Your App name

all_settings.title: App Icon
all_settings.description: Specify the App icon

all_settings.title: Logo Target Path
all_settings.description: Specify where clicking the logo would take the user' Default value of None will take you to '/superset/welcome' You can also specify a relative URL e.g. '/superset/welcome' or '/dashboards/list' or you can specify a full URL e.g. 'https://foo.bar'

all_settings.title: Logo Tooltip
all_settings.description: Specify tooltip that should appear when hovering over the App Icon/Logo

all_settings.title: Fab Api Swagger Ui
all_settings.description: Enables SWAGGER UI for superset openapi spec ex: http://localhost:8080/swagger/v1

all_settings.title: Auth Type
all_settings.description: The authentication type AUTH_OID : Is for OpenID AUTH_DB : Is for database (username/password) AUTH_LDAP : Is for LDAP AUTH_REMOTE_USER : Is for using REMOTE_USER from web server

all_settings.title: Babel Default Folder
all_settings.description: Your application default translation path

all_settings.title: Languages
all_settings.description: Turning off i18n by default as translation in most languages are incomplete and not well maintained.

all_settings.title: Ssh Tunnel Timeout Sec
all_settings.description: : Timeout (seconds) for tunnel connection (open_channel timeout)

all_settings.title: Ssh Tunnel Packet Timeout Sec
all_settings.description: : Timeout (seconds) for transport socket (``socket.settimeout``)

all_settings.title: Cache Warmup Executors
all_settings.description: a fixed user (admin in this example), use the following configuration: from superset.tasks.types import ExecutorType, FixedExecutor CACHE_WARMUP_EXECUTORS = [ExecutorType.OWNER, FixedExecutor("admin")]

all_settings.title: Thumbnail Executors
all_settings.description: configuration: from superset.tasks.types import ExecutorType, FixedExecutor THUMBNAIL_EXECUTORS = [FixedExecutor("admin")]

all_settings.title: Screenshot Locate Wait
all_settings.description: Time before selenium times out after trying to locate an element on the page and wait for that element to load for a screenshot.

all_settings.title: Screenshot Load Wait
all_settings.description: Time before selenium times out after waiting for all DOM class elements named "loading" are gone.

all_settings.title: Screenshot Selenium Retries
all_settings.description: Selenium destroy retries

all_settings.title: Screenshot Selenium Headstart
all_settings.description: Give selenium an headstart, in seconds

all_settings.title: Screenshot Selenium Animation Wait
all_settings.description: Wait for the chart animation, in seconds

all_settings.title: Screenshot Replace Unexpected Errors
all_settings.description: Replace unexpected errors in screenshots with real error messages

all_settings.title: Screenshot Wait For Error Modal Visible
all_settings.description: Max time to wait for error message modal to show up, in seconds

all_settings.title: Screenshot Wait For Error Modal Invisible
all_settings.description: Max time to wait for error message modal to close, in seconds

all_settings.title: Screenshot Playwright Wait Event
all_settings.description: Event that Playwright waits for when loading a new page Possible values: "load", "commit", "domcontentloaded", "networkidle" Docs: https://playwright.dev/python/docs/api/class-page#page-goto-option-wait-until

all_settings.title: Screenshot Playwright Default Timeout
all_settings.description: Default timeout for Playwright browser context for all operations

all_settings.title: Cache Default Timeout
all_settings.description: --------------------------------------------------- Cache configuration --------------------------------------------------- Default cache timeout, applies to all cache backends unless specifically overridden in each cache config.

all_settings.title: Store Cache Keys In Metadata Db
all_settings.description: store cache keys by datasource UID (via CacheKey) for custom processing/invalidation

all_settings.title: Enable Cors
all_settings.description: CORS Options NOTE: enabling this requires installing the cors-related python dependencies `pip install .[cors]` or `pip install apache_superset[cors]`, depending

all_settings.title: Html Sanitization
all_settings.description: Sanitizes the HTML content used in markdowns to allow its rendering in a safe manner. Disabling this option is not recommended for security reasons. If you wish to allow valid safe elements that are not included in the default sanitization schema, use the HTML_SANITIZATION_SCHEMA_EXTENSIONS configuration.

all_settings.title: Superset Webserver Domains
all_settings.description: than 6 slices in dashboard, a lot of time fetch requests are queued up and wait for next available socket. PR #5039 added domain sharding for Superset, and this feature can be enabled by configuration only (by default Superset doesn't allow cross-domain request). This feature is deprecated, annd will be removed in the next major version of Superset, as enabling HTTP2 will serve the same goals.

all_settings.title: Excel Extensions
all_settings.description: Allowed format types for upload on Database view

all_settings.title: Csv Export
all_settings.description: CSV Options: key/value pairs that will be passed as argument to DataFrame.to_csv method. note: index option should not be overridden

all_settings.title: Logging Configurator
all_settings.description: 1) https://docs.python-guide.org/writing/logging/ 2) https://docs.python.org/2/library/logging.config.html Default configurator will consume the LOG_* settings below

all_settings.title: Log Format
all_settings.description: Console Log Settings

all_settings.title: Query Logger
all_settings.description: client=None, security_manager=None, log_params=None, ): pass

all_settings.title: Mapbox Api Key
all_settings.description: Set this API key to enable Mapbox visualizations

all_settings.title: Sql Max Row
all_settings.description: Maximum number of rows returned for any analytical database query

all_settings.title: Table Viz Max Row Server
all_settings.description: Maximum number of rows for any query with Server Pagination in Table Viz type

all_settings.title: Display Max Row
all_settings.description: Maximum number of rows displayed in SQL Lab UI Is set to avoid out of memory/localstorage issues in browsers. Does not affect exported CSVs

all_settings.title: Default Sqllab Limit
all_settings.description: Default row limit for SQL Lab queries. Is overridden by setting a new limit in the SQL Lab UI

all_settings.title: Sqllab Save Warning Message
all_settings.description: Adds a warning message on sqllab save query and schedule query modals.

all_settings.title: Sqllab Payload Max Mb
all_settings.description: Max payload size (MB) for SQL Lab to prevent browser hangs with large results.

all_settings.title: Dashboard Auto Refresh Intervals
all_settings.description: Dashboard auto refresh intervals

all_settings.title: Celery Beat Scheduler Expires
all_settings.description: This is used as a workaround for the alerts & reports scheduler task to get the time celery beat triggered it, see https://github.com/celery/celery/issues/6974 for details

all_settings.title: Default Db Id
all_settings.description: The db id here results in selecting this one as a default in SQL Lab

all_settings.title: Sqllab Timeout
all_settings.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab synchronous queries

all_settings.title: Sqllab Validation Timeout
all_settings.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab query validation

all_settings.title: Sqllab Default Dbid
all_settings.description: SQLLAB_DEFAULT_DBID

all_settings.title: Sqllab Async Time Limit Sec
all_settings.description: The MAX duration a query can run for before being killed by celery.

all_settings.title: Sqllab Query Cost Estimate Timeout
all_settings.description: Some databases support running EXPLAIN queries that allow users to estimate query costs before they run. These EXPLAIN queries should have a small timeout.

all_settings.title: Sqllab Query Result Timeout
all_settings.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab fetching query results by the resultsKey. 0 means no timeout.

all_settings.title: Sqllab Ctas No Limit
all_settings.description: Flag that controls if limit should be enforced on the CTA (create table as queries).

all_settings.title: Results Backend Use Msgpack
all_settings.description: Use PyArrow and MessagePack for async query results serialization, rather than JSON. This feature requires additional testing from the community before it is fully adopted, so this config option is provided in order to disable should breaking issues be discovered.

all_settings.title: Csv To Hive Upload S3 Bucket
all_settings.description: The S3 bucket where you want to store your external hive tables created from CSV files. For example, 'companyname-superset'

all_settings.title: Csv To Hive Upload Directory
all_settings.description: The directory within the bucket specified above that will contain all the external tables

all_settings.title: Csv Default Na Names
all_settings.description: Values that should be treated as nulls for the csv uploads.

all_settings.title: Robot Permission Roles
all_settings.description: Roles that are controlled by the API / Superset and should not be changed by humans.

all_settings.title: Flask App Mutator
all_settings.description: If a callable is specified, it will be called at app startup while passing a reference to the Flask app. This can be used to alter the Flask app in whatever way. example: FLASK_APP_MUTATOR = lambda x: x.before_request = f

all_settings.title: Smtp Host
all_settings.description: smtp server configuration

all_settings.title: Smtp Ssl Server Auth
all_settings.description: If True creates a default SSL context with ssl.Purpose.CLIENT_AUTH using the default system root CA certificates.

all_settings.title: Silence Fab
all_settings.description: Whether to bump the logging level to ERROR on the flask_appbuilder package Set to False if/when debugging FAB related issues like permission management

all_settings.title: Fab Add Security View Menu View
Fab Add Security Permission Views View
Troubleshooting Link
all_settings.description: The link to a page containing common errors and their resolutions It will be appended at the bottom of sql_lab errors.

all_settings.title: Wtf Csrf Time Limit
all_settings.description: CSRF token timeout, set to None for a token that never expires

all_settings.title: Permission Instructions Link
all_settings.description: This link should lead to a page with instructions on how to gain access to a Datasource. It will be placed at the bottom of permissions errors.

all_settings.title: Tracking Url Transformer
all_settings.description: to your transformer function, e.g.: TRACKING_URL_TRANSFORMER = ( lambda url, query: url if is_fresh(query) else None ) pylint: disable-next=unnecessary-lambda-assignment

all_settings.title: Presto Poll Interval
all_settings.description: Interval between consecutive polls when using Presto Engine See here: https://github.com/dropbox/PyHive/blob/8eb0aeab8ca300f3024655419b93dad926c1a351/pyhive/presto.py#L93  # noqa: E501

all_settings.title: Dashboard Template Id
all_settings.description: The id of a template dashboard that should be copied to every new user

all_settings.title: Db Connection Mutator
all_settings.description: uri.username = user.email return uri, params Note that the returned uri and params are passed directly to sqlalchemy's as such `create_engine(url, **params)`

all_settings.title: Mutate After Split
all_settings.description: It allows for using the SQL_QUERY_MUTATOR function for more than comments Usage: If you want to apply a change to every statement to a given query, set MUTATE_AFTER_SPLIT = True  # noqa: E501 An example use case is if data has role based access controls, and you want to apply a SET ROLE statement alongside every user query. Changing this variable maintains functionality for both the SQL_Lab and Charts.

all_settings.title: Mutate Alert Query
all_settings.description: Boolean config that determines if alert SQL queries should also be mutated or not.

all_settings.title: Machine Auth Provider Class
all_settings.description: This auth provider is used by background (offline) tasks that need to access protected resources. Can be overridden by end users in order to support custom auth mechanisms

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Cron Window Size
all_settings.description: --------------------------------------------------- Alerts & Reports --------------------------------------------------- Used for Alerts/Reports (Feature flask ALERT_REPORTS) to set the size for the sliding cron window size, should be synced with the celery beat config minus 1 second

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Working Time Out Kill
Alert Reports Working Time Out Lag
all_settings.description: if ALERT_REPORTS_WORKING_TIME_OUT_KILL is True, set a celery hard timeout Equal to working timeout + ALERT_REPORTS_WORKING_TIME_OUT_LAG

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Working Soft Time Out Lag
all_settings.description: if ALERT_REPORTS_WORKING_TIME_OUT_KILL is True, set a celery hard timeout Equal to working timeout + ALERT_REPORTS_WORKING_SOFT_TIME_OUT_LAG

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Default Working Timeout
all_settings.description: Default values that user using when creating alert

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Notification Dry Run
all_settings.description: If set to true no notification is sent, the worker will just log a message. Useful for debugging

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Query Execution Max Tries
all_settings.description: Max tries to run queries to prevent false errors caused by transient errors being returned to users. Set to a value >1 to enable retries.

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Min Custom Screenshot Width
all_settings.description: Custom width for screenshots

all_settings.title: Alert Reports Max Custom Screenshot Width
Alert Minimum Interval
all_settings.description: Set a minimum interval threshold between executions (for each Alert/Report) Value should be an integer i.e. int(timedelta(minutes=5).total_seconds()) You can also assign a function to the config that returns the expected integer

all_settings.title: Email Reports Subject Prefix
all_settings.description: A custom prefix to use on all Alerts & Reports emails

all_settings.title: Email Reports Cta
all_settings.description: The text for call-to-action link in Alerts & Reports emails

all_settings.title: Webdriver Type
all_settings.description: Requires: geckodriver and firefox installations Limitations: can be buggy at times chrome: Requires: headless chrome Limitations: unable to generate screenshots of elements

all_settings.title: Webdriver Window
all_settings.description: Window size - this will impact the rendering of the data

all_settings.title: Webdriver Auth Func
all_settings.description: An optional override to the default auth hook used to provide auth to the offline webdriver (when using Selenium) or browser context (when using Playwright - see PLAYWRIGHT_REPORTS_AND_THUMBNAILS feature flag)

all_settings.title: Webdriver Configuration
all_settings.description: Any config options to be passed as-is to the webdriver

all_settings.title: Webdriver Option Args
all_settings.description: Additional args to be passed as arguments to the config object Note: If using Chrome, you'll want to add the "--marionette" arg.

all_settings.title: Webdriver Baseurl
all_settings.description: The base URL to query for accessing the user interface

all_settings.title: Webdriver Baseurl User Friendly
all_settings.description: The base URL for the email report hyperlinks.

all_settings.title: Email Page Render Wait
all_settings.description: Time selenium will wait for the page to load and render for the email report.

all_settings.title: Bug Report Url
all_settings.description: Send user to a link where they can report bugs

all_settings.title: Documentation Url
all_settings.description: Send user to a link where they can read more about Superset

all_settings.title: Default Relative Start Time
all_settings.description: 'now' means it is relative to the query issue time If both start and end time is set to now, this will make the time filter a moving window. By only setting the end time to now, start time will be set to midnight, while end will be relative to the query issue time.

all_settings.title: Sql Validators By Engine
all_settings.description: Configure which SQL validator to use for each engine

all_settings.title: Test Database Connection Timeout
all_settings.description: When adding a new database we try to connect to it. Depending on which parameters are incorrect this could take a couple minutes, until the SQLAlchemy driver pinging the database times out. Instead of relying on the driver timeout we can specify a shorter one here.

all_settings.title: Database Oauth2 Jwt Algorithm
all_settings.description: OAuth2 state is encoded in a JWT using the alogorithm below.

all_settings.title: Database Oauth2 Timeout
all_settings.description: applications. In that case, the proxy can forward the request to the correct instance by looking at the `default_redirect_uri` attribute in the OAuth2 state object. DATABASE_OAUTH2_REDIRECT_URI = "http://localhost:8088/api/v1/database/oauth2/" Timeout when fetching access and refresh tokens.

all_settings.title: Content Security Policy Warning
all_settings.description: Enable/disable CSP warning

all_settings.title: Talisman Config
all_settings.description: If you want Talisman, how do you want it configured?? For more information on setting up Talisman, please refer to https://superset.apache.org/docs/configuration/networking-settings/#changing-flask-talisman-csp

all_settings.title: Talisman Dev Config
all_settings.description: React requires `eval` to work correctly in dev mode

all_settings.title: Session Cookie Httponly
all_settings.description: Flask session cookie options See https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/1.1.x/security/#set-cookie-options for details

all_settings.title: Session Server Side
all_settings.description: Whether to use server side sessions from flask-session or Flask secure cookies

all_settings.title: Send File Max Age Default
all_settings.description: Other possible config options and backends: # https://flask-session.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html Cache static resources.

all_settings.title: Sqlalchemy Examples Uri
all_settings.description: URI to database storing the example data, points to SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI by default if set to `None`

all_settings.title: Static Assets Prefix
all_settings.description: Optional prefix to be added to all static asset paths when rendering the UI. This is useful for hosting assets in an external CDN, for example

all_settings.title: Prevent Unsafe Db Connections
all_settings.description: Some sqlalchemy connection strings can open Superset to security risks. Typically these should not be allowed.

all_settings.title: Prevent Unsafe Default Urls On Dataset
all_settings.description: If true all default urls on datasets will be handled as relative URLs by the frontend

all_settings.title: Dataset Import Allowed Data Urls
all_settings.description: Define a list of allowed URLs for dataset data imports (v1). Simple example to only allow URLs that belong to certain domains: ALLOWED_IMPORT_URL_DOMAINS = [ r"^https://.+\.domain1\.com\/?.*", r"^https://.+\.domain2\.com\/?.*" ]

all_settings.title: Sqla Table Mutator
all_settings.description: to allow mutating the object with this callback. This can be used to set any properties of the object based on naming conventions and such. You can find examples in the tests. pylint: disable-next=unnecessary-lambda-assignment

all_settings.title: Global Async Query Manager Class
all_settings.description: Global async query config options. Requires GLOBAL_ASYNC_QUERIES feature flag to be enabled.

all_settings.title: Global Async Queries Redis Stream Prefix
Global Async Queries Redis Stream Limit
Global Async Queries Redis Stream Limit Firehose
Global Async Queries Register Request Handlers
Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Name
Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Secure
Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Domain
Global Async Queries Cache Backend
all_settings.description: Global async queries cache backend configuration options: - Set 'CACHE_TYPE' to 'RedisCache' for RedisCacheBackend. - Set 'CACHE_TYPE' to 'RedisSentinelCache' for RedisSentinelCacheBackend.

all_settings.title: Guest Role Name
all_settings.description: Embedded config options

all_settings.title: Guest Token Validator Hook
all_settings.description: lambda x: len(x['rls']) == 1 and "tenant_id=" in x['rls'][0]['clause'] Takes the GuestTokenUser dict as an argument Return False from the callable to return a HTTP 400 to the user.

all_settings.title: Zipped File Max Size
all_settings.description: Max allowed size for a zipped file

all_settings.title: Zip File Max Compress Ratio
all_settings.description: Max allowed compression ratio for a zipped file

all_settings.title: Environment Tag Config
all_settings.description: Configuration for environment tag shown on the navbar. Setting 'text' to '' will hide the tag.  # noqa: E501 'color' can either be a hex color code, or a dot-indexed theme color (e.g. error.base)

general.description: Values that should be treated as nulls for the csv uploads.

general.title: Csv Export
general.description: CSV Options: key/value pairs that will be passed as argument to DataFrame.to_csv method. note: index option should not be overridden

general.title: Csv To Hive Upload Directory
general.description: The directory within the bucket specified above that will contain all the external tables

general.title: Csv To Hive Upload S3 Bucket
general.description: The S3 bucket where you want to store your external hive tables created from CSV files. For example, 'companyname-superset'

general.title: Dashboard Auto Refresh Intervals
general.description: Dashboard auto refresh intervals

general.title: Dashboard Template Id
general.description: The id of a template dashboard that should be copied to every new user

general.title: Dataset Import Allowed Data Urls
general.description: Define a list of allowed URLs for dataset data imports (v1). Simple example to only allow URLs that belong to certain domains: ALLOWED_IMPORT_URL_DOMAINS = [ r"^https://.+\.domain1\.com\/?.*", r"^https://.+\.domain2\.com\/?.*" ]

general.title: Default Relative Start Time
general.description: 'now' means it is relative to the query issue time If both start and end time is set to now, this will make the time filter a moving window. By only setting the end time to now, start time will be set to midnight, while end will be relative to the query issue time.

general.title: Default Time Filter
general.description: default time filter in explore values may be "Last day", "Last week", "<ISO date> : now", etc.

general.title: Default Viz Type
general.description: default viz used in chart explorer & SQL Lab explore

general.title: Display Max Row
general.description: Maximum number of rows displayed in SQL Lab UI Is set to avoid out of memory/localstorage issues in browsers. Does not affect exported CSVs

general.title: Documentation Url
general.description: Send user to a link where they can read more about Superset

general.title: Environment Tag Config
general.description: Configuration for environment tag shown on the navbar. Setting 'text' to '' will hide the tag.  # noqa: E501 'color' can either be a hex color code, or a dot-indexed theme color (e.g. error.base)

general.title: Excel Extensions
general.description: Allowed format types for upload on Database view

general.title: Favicons
general.description: "href":path/to/image.png", "sizes": "16x16", "type": "image/png" "rel": "icon" },

general.title: Flask App Mutator
general.description: If a callable is specified, it will be called at app startup while passing a reference to the Flask app. This can be used to alter the Flask app in whatever way. example: FLASK_APP_MUTATOR = lambda x: x.before_request = f

general.title: Guest Role Name
general.description: Embedded config options

general.title: Guest Token Validator Hook
general.description: lambda x: len(x['rls']) == 1 and "tenant_id=" in x['rls'][0]['clause'] Takes the GuestTokenUser dict as an argument Return False from the callable to return a HTTP 400 to the user.

general.title: Html Sanitization
general.description: Sanitizes the HTML content used in markdowns to allow its rendering in a safe manner. Disabling this option is not recommended for security reasons. If you wish to allow valid safe elements that are not included in the default sanitization schema, use the HTML_SANITIZATION_SCHEMA_EXTENSIONS configuration.

general.title: Languages
general.description: Turning off i18n by default as translation in most languages are incomplete and not well maintained.

general.title: Mapbox Api Key
general.description: Set this API key to enable Mapbox visualizations

general.title: Mutate After Split
general.description: It allows for using the SQL_QUERY_MUTATOR function for more than comments Usage: If you want to apply a change to every statement to a given query, set MUTATE_AFTER_SPLIT = True  # noqa: E501 An example use case is if data has role based access controls, and you want to apply a SET ROLE statement alongside every user query. Changing this variable maintains functionality for both the SQL_Lab and Charts.

general.title: Permission Instructions Link
general.description: This link should lead to a page with instructions on how to gain access to a Datasource. It will be placed at the bottom of permissions errors.

general.title: Presto Poll Interval
general.description: Interval between consecutive polls when using Presto Engine See here: https://github.com/dropbox/PyHive/blob/8eb0aeab8ca300f3024655419b93dad926c1a351/pyhive/presto.py#L93  # noqa: E501

general.title: Prevent Unsafe Default Urls On Dataset
general.description: If true all default urls on datasets will be handled as relative URLs by the frontend

general.title: Profiling
general.description: Enable profiling of Python calls. Turn this on and append ``?_instrument=1`` to the page to see the call stack.

general.title: Results Backend Use Msgpack
general.description: Use PyArrow and MessagePack for async query results serialization, rather than JSON. This feature requires additional testing from the community before it is fully adopted, so this config option is provided in order to disable should breaking issues be discovered.

general.title: Robot Permission Roles
general.description: Roles that are controlled by the API / Superset and should not be changed by humans.

general.title: Screenshot Load Wait
general.description: Time before selenium times out after waiting for all DOM class elements named "loading" are gone.

general.title: Screenshot Locate Wait
general.description: Time before selenium times out after trying to locate an element on the page and wait for that element to load for a screenshot.

general.title: Screenshot Playwright Wait Event
general.description: Event that Playwright waits for when loading a new page Possible values: "load", "commit", "domcontentloaded", "networkidle" Docs: https://playwright.dev/python/docs/api/class-page#page-goto-option-wait-until

general.title: Screenshot Replace Unexpected Errors
general.description: Replace unexpected errors in screenshots with real error messages

general.title: Screenshot Selenium Animation Wait
general.description: Wait for the chart animation, in seconds

general.title: Screenshot Selenium Headstart
general.description: Give selenium an headstart, in seconds

general.title: Screenshot Selenium Retries
general.description: Selenium destroy retries

general.title: Screenshot Wait For Error Modal Invisible
general.description: Max time to wait for error message modal to close, in seconds

general.title: Screenshot Wait For Error Modal Visible
general.description: Max time to wait for error message modal to show up, in seconds

general.title: Secret Key
general.description: Your App secret key. Make sure you override it on superset_config.py or use `SUPERSET_SECRET_KEY` environment variable. Use a strong complex alphanumeric string and use a tool to help you generate a sufficiently random sequence, ex: openssl rand -base64 42"

general.title: Send File Max Age Default
general.description: Other possible config options and backends: # https://flask-session.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html Cache static resources.

general.title: Session Cookie Httponly
general.description: Flask session cookie options See https://flask.palletsprojects.com/en/1.1.x/security/#set-cookie-options for details

general.title: Session Server Side
general.description: Whether to use server side sessions from flask-session or Flask secure cookies

general.title: Show Stacktrace
general.description: Superset allows server-side python stacktraces to be surfaced to the user when this feature is on. This may have security implications and it's more secure to turn it off in production settings.

general.title: Silence Fab
general.description: Whether to bump the logging level to ERROR on the flask_appbuilder package Set to False if/when debugging FAB related issues like permission management

general.title: Static Assets Prefix
general.description: Optional prefix to be added to all static asset paths when rendering the UI. This is useful for hosting assets in an external CDN, for example

general.title: Superset Dashboard Periodical Refresh Warning Message
Superset Webserver Domains
general.description: than 6 slices in dashboard, a lot of time fetch requests are queued up and wait for next available socket. PR #5039 added domain sharding for Superset, and this feature can be enabled by configuration only (by default Superset doesn't allow cross-domain request). This feature is deprecated, annd will be removed in the next major version of Superset, as enabling HTTP2 will serve the same goals.

general.title: Table Viz Max Row Server
general.description: Maximum number of rows for any query with Server Pagination in Table Viz type

general.title: Talisman Config
general.description: If you want Talisman, how do you want it configured?? For more information on setting up Talisman, please refer to https://superset.apache.org/docs/configuration/networking-settings/#changing-flask-talisman-csp

general.title: Talisman Dev Config
general.description: React requires `eval` to work correctly in dev mode

general.title: Thumbnail Executors
general.description: configuration: from superset.tasks.types import ExecutorType, FixedExecutor THUMBNAIL_EXECUTORS = [FixedExecutor("admin")]

general.title: Tracking Url Transformer
general.description: to your transformer function, e.g.: TRACKING_URL_TRANSFORMER = ( lambda url, query: url if is_fresh(query) else None ) pylint: disable-next=unnecessary-lambda-assignment

general.title: Troubleshooting Link
general.description: The link to a page containing common errors and their resolutions It will be appended at the bottom of sql_lab errors.

general.title: Version String
general.description: version_info.json file may or may not be available, as it is generated on install via setup.py. In the event that we're actually running Superset, we will have already installed, therefore it WILL exist. When unit tests are running, however, it WILL NOT exist, so we fall back on reading package.json

general.title: Webdriver Baseurl
general.description: The base URL to query for accessing the user interface

general.title: Webdriver Baseurl User Friendly
general.description: The base URL for the email report hyperlinks.

general.title: Webdriver Configuration
general.description: Any config options to be passed as-is to the webdriver

general.title: Webdriver Option Args
general.description: Additional args to be passed as arguments to the config object Note: If using Chrome, you'll want to add the "--marionette" arg.

general.title: Webdriver Type
general.description: Requires: geckodriver and firefox installations Limitations: can be buggy at times chrome: Requires: headless chrome Limitations: unable to generate screenshots of elements

general.title: Webdriver Window
general.description: Window size - this will impact the rendering of the data

general.title: Wtf Csrf Exempt List
general.description: Add endpoints that need to be exempt from CSRF protection

general.title: Zipped File Max Size
general.description: Max allowed size for a zipped file

general.title: Zip File Max Compress Ratio
general.description: Max allowed compression ratio for a zipped file

ui.title: Build Number
ui.description: Build number is shown in the About section if available. This can be replaced at build time to expose build information.

ui.title: Fab Api Swagger Ui
ui.description: Enables SWAGGER UI for superset openapi spec ex: http://localhost:8080/swagger/v1

performance.title: Alert Reports Default Working Timeout
performance.description: Default values that user using when creating alert

performance.title: Cache Default Timeout
performance.description: --------------------------------------------------- Cache configuration --------------------------------------------------- Default cache timeout, applies to all cache backends unless specifically overridden in each cache config.

performance.title: Cache Warmup Executors
performance.description: a fixed user (admin in this example), use the following configuration: from superset.tasks.types import ExecutorType, FixedExecutor CACHE_WARMUP_EXECUTORS = [ExecutorType.OWNER, FixedExecutor("admin")]

performance.title: Database Oauth2 Timeout
performance.description: applications. In that case, the proxy can forward the request to the correct instance by looking at the `default_redirect_uri` attribute in the OAuth2 state object. DATABASE_OAUTH2_REDIRECT_URI = "http://localhost:8088/api/v1/database/oauth2/" Timeout when fetching access and refresh tokens.

performance.title: Default Sqllab Limit
performance.description: Default row limit for SQL Lab queries. Is overridden by setting a new limit in the SQL Lab UI

performance.title: Filter Select Row Limit
performance.description: max rows retrieved by filter select auto complete

performance.title: Global Async Queries Cache Backend
performance.description: Global async queries cache backend configuration options: - Set 'CACHE_TYPE' to 'RedisCache' for RedisCacheBackend. - Set 'CACHE_TYPE' to 'RedisSentinelCache' for RedisSentinelCacheBackend.

performance.title: Global Async Queries Redis Stream Limit
Global Async Queries Redis Stream Limit Firehose
Native Filter Default Row Limit
performance.description: default row limit for native filters

performance.title: Query Search Limit
performance.description: The limit of queries fetched for query search

performance.title: Ratelimit Enabled
performance.description: FAB Rate limiting: this is a security feature for preventing DDOS attacks. The feature is on by default to make Superset secure by default, but you should fine tune the limits to your needs. You can read more about the different parameters here: https://flask-limiter.readthedocs.io/en/stable/configuration.html

performance.title: Row Limit
performance.description: default row limit when requesting chart data

performance.title: Samples Row Limit
performance.description: default row limit when requesting samples from datasource in explore view

performance.title: Screenshot Playwright Default Timeout
performance.description: Default timeout for Playwright browser context for all operations

performance.title: Sqllab Async Time Limit Sec
performance.description: The MAX duration a query can run for before being killed by celery.

performance.title: Sqllab Ctas No Limit
performance.description: Flag that controls if limit should be enforced on the CTA (create table as queries).

performance.title: Sqllab Query Cost Estimate Timeout
performance.description: Some databases support running EXPLAIN queries that allow users to estimate query costs before they run. These EXPLAIN queries should have a small timeout.

performance.title: Sqllab Query Result Timeout
performance.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab fetching query results by the resultsKey. 0 means no timeout.

performance.title: Sqllab Timeout
performance.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab synchronous queries

performance.title: Sqllab Validation Timeout
performance.description: Timeout duration for SQL Lab query validation

performance.title: Ssh Tunnel Packet Timeout Sec
performance.description: : Timeout (seconds) for transport socket (``socket.settimeout``)

performance.title: Ssh Tunnel Timeout Sec
performance.description: : Timeout (seconds) for tunnel connection (open_channel timeout)

performance.title: Store Cache Keys In Metadata Db
performance.description: store cache keys by datasource UID (via CacheKey) for custom processing/invalidation

performance.title: Superset Dashboard Periodical Refresh Limit
performance.description: this 2 settings are used by dashboard period force refresh feature When user choose auto force refresh frequency < SUPERSET_DASHBOARD_PERIODICAL_REFRESH_LIMIT they will see warning message in the Refresh Interval Modal. please check PR #9886

performance.title: Superset Webserver Timeout
performance.description: This is an important setting, and should be lower than your [load balancer / proxy / envoy / kong / ...] timeout settings. You should also make sure to configure your WSGI server (gunicorn, nginx, apache, ...) timeout setting to be <= to this setting

performance.title: Test Database Connection Timeout
performance.description: When adding a new database we try to connect to it. Depending on which parameters are incorrect this could take a couple minutes, until the SQLAlchemy driver pinging the database times out. Instead of relying on the driver timeout we can specify a shorter one here.

performance.title: Wtf Csrf Time Limit
performance.description: CSRF token timeout, set to None for a token that never expires

database.title: Alert Reports Query Execution Max Tries
database.description: Max tries to run queries to prevent false errors caused by transient errors being returned to users. Set to a value >1 to enable retries.

database.title: Database Oauth2 Jwt Algorithm
database.description: OAuth2 state is encoded in a JWT using the alogorithm below.

database.title: Db Connection Mutator
database.description: uri.username = user.email return uri, params Note that the returned uri and params are passed directly to sqlalchemy's as such `create_engine(url, **params)`

database.title: Default Db Id
database.description: The db id here results in selecting this one as a default in SQL Lab

database.title: Global Async Query Manager Class
database.description: Global async query config options. Requires GLOBAL_ASYNC_QUERIES feature flag to be enabled.

database.title: Mutate Alert Query
database.description: Boolean config that determines if alert SQL queries should also be mutated or not.

database.title: Prevent Unsafe Db Connections
database.description: Some sqlalchemy connection strings can open Superset to security risks. Typically these should not be allowed.

database.title: Sqlalchemy Custom Password Store
database.description: example: def lookup_password(url): return 'secret' SQLALCHEMY_CUSTOM_PASSWORD_STORE = lookup_password

database.title: Sqlalchemy Encrypted Field Type Adapter
database.description: ) raise Exception("Missing app_config kwarg") SQLALCHEMY_ENCRYPTED_FIELD_TYPE_ADAPTER = AesGcmEncryptedAdapter

database.title: Sqlalchemy Engine Options
database.description: that may be specific to the database engine you are using. Note that you can use this to set the isolation level of your database, as in `SQLALCHEMY_ENGINE_OPTIONS = {"isolation_level": "READ COMMITTED"}` Also note that we recommend READ COMMITTED for regular operation. Find out more here https://flask-sqlalchemy.palletsprojects.com/en/3.1.x/config/

database.title: Sqlalchemy Examples Uri
database.description: URI to database storing the example data, points to SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI by default if set to `None`

database.title: Sqla Table Mutator
database.description: to allow mutating the object with this callback. This can be used to set any properties of the object based on naming conventions and such. You can find examples in the tests. pylint: disable-next=unnecessary-lambda-assignment

database.title: Sqllab Payload Max Mb
database.description: Max payload size (MB) for SQL Lab to prevent browser hangs with large results.

database.title: Sqllab Save Warning Message
database.description: Adds a warning message on sqllab save query and schedule query modals.

database.title: Sql Max Row
database.description: Maximum number of rows returned for any analytical database query

database.title: Sql Validators By Engine
database.description: Configure which SQL validator to use for each engine

features.title: Enable Cors
features.description: CORS Options NOTE: enabling this requires installing the cors-related python dependencies `pip install .[cors]` or `pip install apache_superset[cors]`, depending

features.title: Enable Proxy Fix
features.description: Use all X-Forwarded headers when ENABLE_PROXY_FIX is True. When proxying to a different port, set "x_port" to 0 to avoid downstream issues.

async.title: Celery Beat Scheduler Expires
async.description: This is used as a workaround for the alerts & reports scheduler task to get the time celery beat triggered it, see https://github.com/celery/celery/issues/6974 for details

async.title: Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Domain
Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Name
Global Async Queries Jwt Cookie Secure
Global Async Queries Redis Stream Prefix
Global Async Queries Register Request Handlers

email.title: Email Page Render Wait
email.description: Time selenium will wait for the page to load and render for the email report.

email.title: Email Reports Cta
email.description: The text for call-to-action link in Alerts & Reports emails

email.title: Email Reports Subject Prefix
email.description: A custom prefix to use on all Alerts & Reports emails
